CalvesLV45CalfRaise.name: Lever 45Â° Calf Raise
CalvesLV45CalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform or foot bar with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
CalvesLV45CalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLV45CalfRaise.comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtension.name: Lever Calf Extension
CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtension.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on horizontal foot bar. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtension.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtension.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown). Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses. Also known as Rotary Calf Extension. Exercise can also be performed on Bilateral Lever Calf Extension apparatus.

CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.name: Lever Calf Extension (bilateral)
CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on lever platform or foot pedals. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown). Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses. Also known as rotary calf extension. Exercise can also be performed alternative Lever Calf Extention apparatus.

CalvesLVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.name: Lever Alternating Calf Extension
CalvesLVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on pedals. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
CalvesLVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.execution: Push left pedal by extending ankle as far as possible while allowing right pedal to return back until calf is stretched. Reverse motion by pushing right pedal and allowing left pedal to return back. Continue to alternate motion.
CalvesLVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses. Also see Lever Alternating Bent Knee Calf Extension.

CalvesLVDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Lever Donkey Calf Raise
CalvesLVDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Position lower back and hips under padded lever. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
CalvesLVDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesLVSeatedCalfPress.name: Lever Seated Calf Press
CalvesLVSeatedCalfPress.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
CalvesLVSeatedCalfPress.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVSeatedCalfPress.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that weight bottoms out (weight stack hits bottom) during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesLVStandingCalfRaise.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise
CalvesLVStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
CalvesLVStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVStandingCalfRaise.comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

CalvesLVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise (belt loaded)
CalvesLVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.preparation: Place lever belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before lever and attach belt. Stand on calf block and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
CalvesLVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.comments: Chain with attachment can be preattached to lever so belt can be more easily attached as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses. Also see same movement performed on slightly different apparatus, Cable Standing Calf Raise.

CalvesLVForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Lever Forward Angled Calf Raise
CalvesLVForwardAngledCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on top of calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
CalvesLVForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CalvesLVForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergists muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.
